title: Wisteria by Michael Cera Palin
lyrics:
Oh how you've darl'd me
Though no cause for concern
In season, you impart me
Descending Clovers that I yearn
Our better steps held true
As lesser ends felt too
It's so much nicer being lost in you

Where my lips come unsealed
Where my head comes clear
How I know that you hear me

The ways that I could love you
The ways that I'll let go
You said it'd take getting used to
I said I'd like getting to know

Wisteria in bloom
Where do you twine up to?
You said it'd take getting used to
Why can I say?

You said it looked lovely
My unwell shade of blue
No matter how rich your soil
I still flinched at the roots



Sorry if I'm keeping you up
Kills me to see your eyes so befallen
Sorry if I'm keeping you up
It won't be the last time
Sorry I've been keeping you up
Each waking hour must be more than your bargained
I'm sorry I've been keeping you out
Just can't bear this to be how your eyes remember me

New place, same old
Split hairs, split seams, split ends
New place, same old

Should my lips stay sealed
Could my thoughts be more clear?
Should I hope that you hear me?
Don't I wish you were here?
Should my lips stay sealed
Could my thoughts be more clear
How I hope that you hear me?

The ways I've wished to love you
The ways that I've let go
When you say it like we used to
What can I say?



Sorry I've been keeping you up
It won't be the last time
Sorry I've been keeping you out
Just can't bear this to be
All your eyes should find left of me

Wisteria in bloom
Where do you grow off to?
You say it’s what you’re used to
What I've said
Oh, what I've said!
